Having someone with the very strong products background that Larry has could bring some innovation back to Google Inc. . Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain as executive chairman and will advise Page and Sergey Brin , Google Inc. 's other co-founder. Sergey Brin will give up his title as co-president to work on high-priority projects.

seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana governor's office. "I'm open to running for governor," Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it. Still, many in politics said his decision instantly catapults him as the leading Republican candidate to succeed Gov. Rick Perry Mitch Daniels . has introduced a bill that would cut off federal funding to Planned Parenthood and other abortion providers. The bill, the Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act, has 127 co-sponsors, including seven from California. It is morally wrong to end an unborn human life by abortion, said Mike Pence in a prepared statement. Saying his "heart was in Indiana," Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.
